messages.content: You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is a 55-year-old African-American male that was last seen in clinic on 07/29/2008 with diagnosis of new onset seizures and an MRI scan, which demonstrated right contrast-enhancing temporal mass.  Given the characteristics of this mass and his new onset seizures, it is significantly concerning for a high-grade glioma.
Hello, sir. What is your age and what is your ethnicity?
Good afternoon, sir. Yes, I just turned fifty five.
Happy belated birthday. What brings you in today?
Yes, that's right.
The last time you were here was in oh seven right?
Um, it was on July twenty ninth two thousand eight.
What did the M R I show?
No, I was having those new seizures, remember?
Oh, I am so sorry. I do remember now It showed a new right temporal mass with contrast enhancement.
What exactly does that mean, doctor?
Well given the characteristics of your mass and the new onset of your seizures, I am thinking it's a high grade glioma.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Positive for stroke and sleep apnea.
Oh yes, stroke.
Did you do sleep study?
Sleep apnea.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: MSK: Negative myalgia, negative joint pain, negative stiffness, negative weakness, negative back pain.
How have you been feeling recently?
No, no pain.
Any joint pain or muscle pain?
Um no, I don't feel any joint pain.
What about weakness or loss of muscle strength?
Back pain or stiffness?
Um, nothing like that.
Thank you for the information.
No.
Are your joints feeling more unstable?
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Noncontributory.
What about your family medical history? Any grams or bamps pass from any medical issue?
No.
Any chronic illnesses like high blood pressure?
No.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Father died of a thoracic aortic aneurysm, age 71. Mother died of stroke, age 81.
Hi there.
Oh yeah. My father died of thoracic aortic aneurysm. He was seventy one years old at that time.
What is your mom's medical history?
Yeah, my mom died of stroke. She was around eighty one.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Reviewed and remained unchanged.
Have I reviewed your medical history with you before?
It is good to see you too. I have been good.
So then I will review it again.
No. No changes.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is a 77-year-old female who is unable to give any information.  She has been sedated with Ativan and came into the emergency room obtunded and unable to give any history.  On a chest x-ray for what appeared to be shortness of breath she was found to have what was thought to be free air under the right diaphragm.
Who is your primary doctor, miss?
Do you know or remember how long you will be with us today?
No, I will just be a moment. So, what is going today young lady?
I was called in to interpret her O2 level results. Did she have her x-ray yet?
I am not, she is right here. Hi miss, do you know what you are here for today? What is the man sitting with you?
Miss? Hi, I am waiting for doctor to come interpret your x-ray. You had a chest and lung x-ray taken because of shortness of breath.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Two half-brothers, ages 26 and 28, both in good health.  Parents are in good health.  A maternal great-grandmother had a deep venous thrombosis (DVT) of leg in her 40s.  A maternal great-uncle developed leukemia around age 50.  A maternal great-grandfather had bone cancer around age 80.  His paternal grandfather died of colon cancer at age 73, which he had had since age 68.  Adult-onset diabetes is present in distant relatives on both sides.
Tell me about your medical history, any conditions running in the family?
My parents do not have any health conditions. I have two half brothers that are in good health as well.
Nobody else in the family?
Twenty six and twenty eight. My grandmother on my mom's side had D V T in her leg. I think she was in her forty's.
Oh.

I think my aunt from my dad's side of the family and my cousins on my mom's side of the family are diabetic? Oh. My great grandfather had bone cancer. He was in his eighties. My mom's brother was recently diagnosed with leukemia. He is around fifty years old. Then my dad's dad had colon cancer at seventy three. He had it since he was sixty eight, though. I think that is it.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: He is retired from the social security administration x 20 years.  He travels a lot and is extremely active.  He does not smoke.  He consumes alcohol socially only.  He does not use illicit drugs.  He is married.
What did you do before you retired?
No, I am retired now. I worked for twenty years in social security administration.
Now I just enjoy my life with my wife, we travel a lot. I like to be extremely active.
Are you married?
Do you smoke? Or consume alcohol or use illicit drugs?
Yes, but only socially.
Have you ever used any illicit drugs?
No, I don't smoke or do any kind of drugs or anything.
Thank you for the information.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: No known drug allergies.
Anything I should know, any allergies?
No.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is a 79-year-old African-American female with a self reported height of 5 foot 3 inches and weight of 197 pounds.  She was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes in 1983.  She is not allergic to any medicines.
What is your height, ma'am? And approximately how many pounds do you weigh?
Well, I'm seventy nine, and I'm an African American women.
Thank you.
No, they didn't.
What is your diagnosed type of diabetes, if any?
I'm five foot three inches.
Thank you.
Um, I'm about one hundred ninety seven pounds.
Thank you.
I've had type two diabetes since nineteen eighty three.
Are you allergic to any medications?
No, not that I know of.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Non-contributory. The patient denied fever, chills, ulcers, liver disease or history of gallstones. Vaccines: The patient was vaccinated with BCG before starting elementary school in the Philippines.
Good afternoon. What brings you to the clinic today? Did my nurse take a good look at you?
Yes, he did back in the Philippines before starting his elementary school.
Great, is this your son, sir?
Yes, we submitted it at the front desk.
Perfect. Juts a few more questions and we will be all set. Is there any history of liver disease?
For a few days.
Great, how about chills or fever? Any signs of infection?
No, he had his physical and blood tests and everything came out normal.
Perfect. Any other medical conditions I should be aware of?
No.
Maybe kidney stones?
No.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: He is a tobacco user.  He does not drink.  He lives alone, but has family and social support to look on him.
Do you smoke? Do you drink alcohol?
I uh live alone, but I can count on my family and friends to keep me company.
That is great that you have lots of support. It is good to not live totally by yourself and have people to watch over you.
Yeah, I'd say so.
Thank you for the information.
I smoke, but I don't drink.
Thank you for the information.
Yeah, yeah. I've heard this talk one too many times. I'll try to quit eventually.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Generalized anxiety and hypertension, both under fair control.
How are you feeling today?
Good, I guess.
You seem anxious.
I recently started therapy and I'm scheduled to see a psychiatrist sometime next week.
Your last few records show that you feel uncomfortable talking to me?
I've been taking my blood pressure meds so it's been fine.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Negative for use of alcohol or tobacco.
Do you smoke or drink?
I am doing well.
You don't drink or smoke?
I have some questions about my liver.
Thank you for providing the information.
No, I do not. I take a lot of Tylenol for pain and I am worried it is effecting my liver.
Lets stay on the topic of your alcohol and nicotine use for now.
No, I do not smoke.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Not otherwise pertinent.
How long have you been living in the area? Or are you new to the area?
Hm.
Is something wrong with the address?
Nope.
I see completed forms, but I still have to ask everyone these questions from my checklist, sorry. Are you-
Nope, nothing new.
And nothing new with the constitution of your family? Did you get a new roommate? Or has someone new moved in since you were last here?
Nope.
Are you still working with your hands, like with jewelry or painting?
I can't think of any.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: EXTREMITIES: No cyanosis, clubbing or edema.
I'm going to check your extremities. No discoloration, clubbing, or swelling here.
Not that I notice.
Come in.
Nope.
From what I can see, you don't have any swelling in your fingers. That's good. Keep an eye on it. Swelling could mean a couple different things.
No.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: She has not had any prior surgeries.  Her general health has been excellent except for the above-indicated problems.
So, have you had any surgeries?
No. I have never had any health issues. Other than why I am why I am her today.
Thank you for the information.
I know right? No, I have never had any surgeries.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: 1.  Hypertension. 2.  Hypercholesterolemia. 3.  Osteoarthritis. 4.  Fatigue.
I am always tired, I don't know what to do.
You mentioned that you have heart conditions and osteoarthritis.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is a 49-year-old white female, established patient to Dermatology, last seen in the office on 08/10/2004.  She comes in today for reevaluation of her acne plus she has had what she calls a rash for the past two months now on her chest, stomach, neck, and back.  On examination, this is a flaring of her acne with small folliculitis lesions.  The patient has been taking amoxicillin 500 mg b.i.d. and using Tazorac cream 0.1, and her face is doing well, but she has been out of her medicine now for three days also.  She has also been getting photofacials at Healing Waters and was wondering about what we could offer as far as cosmetic procedures and skin care products, etc.  The patient is married.  She is a secretary.
Nice to meet you, ma'am.
Hi, doctor. Nice to see you again as well. I've been doing fine.
The last time I saw you was in our dermatology office and you were with Doctor Luo. How has everything been?
He's doing fine. Just working a lot.
I know how that feels. So, remind me, how old are you?
Oh, yes. I am white.
Haha, no, no. That's not what I meant. The question was, how old are you?
Yeah, I am. My secretary position has been super stressful lately.
It's a stressful time of year for any type of employment.
I think it's been getting better, but I've had this rash for the last two months on my chest, stomach, neck, and back.
I'm sorry to hear that. Rashes can be really brutal sometimes. Before we start the reevaluation, do you remember the last time you were in my office?
Oh, no. Is that bad?
Haha, no it's okay. I was just curious.
Oh, really. Is it because I stopped my medication for the last three days?

Yes, I know he did a great job, but seeing Doctor Luo kind of jogged my memory. The last time I saw you was August tenth two thousand and four. It's been a while we should have someone look at this before it gets any worse.
Yeah, they have. I noticed my face started to get better.
What have they had you take?
I actually started going to Healing Waters to get photofacials.
How did it start and it looks like it might have spread? Oh, I see. I think this is just a flare up of the acne. Let me go take a look at the folliculitis.
Yeah, it has, but I want a faster treatment. I'm only forty nine and want to look younger. Are there any procedures or skin care products that can be used to help my face look better?

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: He says he has had numbness of toes for a long time.  He denies any visual problems.  His legs have been swelling up from time to time for a long time.  He also has history of COPD and gets short of breath with minimal activity.  He is also not able to walk due to his weight.  He has had ulcers on his legs, which he gets discharge from.  He has chronic back pain and takes OxyContin.  He denies any constipation, diarrhea, abdominal pain, nausea or vomiting.  There is no chest pain.  He does get short of breath on walking.
Which primarily brings you into the office today, sir? Your referral states it could be a T A R N fixation O R some numbness to the toes? Can you confirm?
Hi! I am stuck in here, so I am not doing great.
I am sorry to hear that, sir. What is frustrating you the most?
They swell up like this from time to time but it has been happening for a long time. I also can't feel my toes.
Oh wow! That's not good. I will run some tests and see what's going on.
A long time.
I will also take a look at your legs and evaluate the extent of swelling. And I am curious, have you had any discharge from ulcers?
I can't walk because of my weight. It is too much for me. When I try to get up, I get short of breath. I have C O P D. I can't do much but sit here. I am in a lot of pain all the time.
What do you do for back pain?
No. I just feel out of breath.

I will have you weigh in here and we will consider some stress relief exercises after we get the lab results in. You are prone to getting ulcers with the discharge and C O P D. If you do not have enough oxygen in your body, it is hard to heel and it is likely you are getting these leg ulcers because you need more oxygen in your body. Other symptoms like constipations, diarrhea, chest pain, nausea, vomiting?
I take OxyContin for my back pain.
That's good.
No. I have these sore on my legs, that ooze.
Thank you for the information. It sounds like just bad weather going around the city in general.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Multiple problems, main one is chest pain at night.
Hello, how are you? Ah, you are a familiar face, do not remember the last time I saw you though.
For the most part, yeah. It's been happening the last few nights.
I see. And what exactly have you been experiencing, sir?
Like a gnawing sensation.
In your chest?
Few seconds I think.
Can you elaborate more here? And any specific time then you have noticed the pain?
I'd say it's about a five or six outta ten.
Have you had any pain or discomfort in your chest?
No.
Any shortness of breath or nausea?
No, mainly just the chest pain, and of course, everything else I follow up with you about.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Remarkable for being married, retired, quit smoking in 1997, rare use of alcohol, lives locally with his wife.

Hi Paul, we're with Doctor Quang today're here to ask you some questions and like always Doctor Quang speak with you after we ask you some questions okay. So, first question are you married and do you live together or separately?
I have been happily married for forty five years.
That's wonderful.

Yes, we have a small house by the bay just two miles away from your office. This is my dream house. I always dreamt of living in a house with a waterfront and when I retired, I moved here with my wife. It's nice and peaceful.
Been married for forty five years must be nice to spend retirement with your wife.
Oh, I quit smoking long time ago. Was it ninety six or ninety seven? Hm I think I quit smoking in nineteen ninety seven. I do enjoy a glass of wine or beer but very occasionally.
Okay no history of boozing, correct?

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient has sinus and CVA.  He is a nonsmoker.  No known drug allergies.
Is your case of sinus related to your recent in C V A?
Okay.
Are you having any other issues right now?
I have sinus. I also had a stroke around two years ago.
Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
Nope, never did any of those.
Do you have any known allergies to food, medication, or previously experienced adverse reaction?
No, no known allergies.
Thank you for the information so far.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: To follow a low-salt diet.
Your blood pressure is pretty borderline. I want to control it with diet before we consider you on any medications. Would you consider a low salt diet?
Do you mean like chips and junk food?
Yes. I want you to cut back on foods like fast food and other rich processed foods high in sodium. Are you able to see a nutritionist for a consult?
Okay. Why?
Well, I think a professional advice will be helpful for you to understand which foods contain hidden salt and the right amount for you.
Okay I will cut it.
Great, thanks.
Okay.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Positive for arthritis in his grandmother.  No history of pediatric arthritis.  There is history of psoriasis in his dad.
Is there an arthritis history in your family?
I know that my grandma had arthritis.
What about in children? Did anyone in your family have arthritis when they were kids?
No, I didn't have anything like that. I thought only old people got that.
Lucky you! Did anyone have psoriasis?
Yes, my dad has that. I see the commercials for the medicines all the time.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is a 68-year-old man who returns for recheck.  He has a history of ischemic cardiac disease, he did see Dr. XYZ in February 2004 and had a thallium treadmill test.  He did walk for 8 minutes.  The scan showed some mild inferior wall scar and ejection fraction was well preserved.  He has not had difficulty with chest pain, palpitations, orthopnea, nocturnal dyspnea, or edema.
Hello, sir, how are you today?
Sixty eight. Yes. I saw doctor X Y Z in February two thousand four and he made me walk on a treadmill for eight minutes. Do you have the results from that?

Yes. This thallium treadmill test showed that there is some mild scaring on your inferior wall of the heart. Your ejection fraction was preserved, though. Have you had chest pain, palpitations, shortness of breath at night, or had any swelling?
I do not have any issues like that.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and fever.
Any history of nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or fever, ma'am?
Yes, all of the above.
Thank you for the information.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is discharged home.
I'm going back home today, Doctor.
That's great. Remind me, who is at home to help care for you?
Actually, I live alone.
Do you have any family in the area that can help?
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Prostate cancer with metastatic disease as previously described.
We um we we um we discussed the possibility of of your dad having metastatic disease related to his prostate cancer. I see here they told me it was advanced prostate cancer.
I had prostate cancer.
And do you know if this affected any other areas other than just the prostate.
Yes, it was metastatic.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient's father also suffered from bilateral hip osteoarthritis.
Has anyone else in your family had lots of hip pain?
What exactly do you mean by that, doctor?
Has anyone in your family had a hip replacement?
Oh, yeah, my dad also has arthritis in both of his hips.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient is a 55-year-old gentleman who presents for further evaluation of right leg weakness.  He has difficulty recollecting the exact details and chronology of his problem.  To the best of his recollection, he thinks that about six months ago he developed weakness of his right leg.  He describes that he is reaching to get something from a cabinet and he noticed that he was unable to stand on his right toe.  Since that time, he has had difficulty pushing off when he walks.  He has mild tingling and numbness in his toes, but this has been a chronic problem and nothing new since he has developed the weakness.  He has chronic mild back pain, but this has been persistent for many years and has not changed.  He has experienced cramps in both calves for the past year.  This dissipated about two months ago.  He does not think that his left leg is weak.  He does not have any bowel or bladder incontinence.  There is no radicular pain.  He does not think that the problem is progressive, meaning that the weakness that he perceives in his right leg is no different than when it was six months ago. He first sought medical attention for this problem in October.  He then saw you a couple of months later.  He has undergone an EMG and nerve conduction studies.  Unfortunately, he cannot undergo an MRI of his spine because he has an ear implant.  He has had a CT scan that shows degenerative changes, but nothing obviously abnormal. In addition, the patient has hyperCKemia.  He tells me that he has had an elevated CK prior to starting taking stat medications, although this is not entirely clear to me.  He thinks that he is not taking Lipitor for about 15 months and thought that his CK was in the 500 or 600s prior to starting it.  Once it was started, it increased to about 800 and then came down to about 500 when it was stopped.  He then had a recent bump again up to the 1000 and since Lipitor has been stopped, his CK apparently has returned to about the 500 or 600s.  I do no have any laboratory data to support these statements by the patient, but he seems to be up to speed on this.  More recently, he has been started taking Zetia. He does not have any proximal weakness.  He denies any myalgias.

Good afternoon, sir. My name is Arinze. I am a nurse practitioner.

Thank you and nice to meet you.

Before we start, I would like to take a look at your chart.

Alright.

So, you are fifty-five years old and here for another assessment, correct?

Yes, that is correct.

Good.

Hello, sir. I am Anna, the medical assistant. I have a few more questions to ask you.

Alright.

So, you are here because of your right leg, correct?

Yes, my whole right leg in general.

What happening in your right leg?

I cannot remember the exact timeline, but I have been having weakness. About six months ago, it first started. I noticed it because I was trying to get something from the closet, but I could not stand on my right toe.

So, you had difficulty trying to stand up?

Yes, exactly. In addition to that, I have a little tingle in my toes, but my toes have been weak. I have been also experiencing numbness in them. My back hurts mildly. It has been hurting mildly for many years now.

Do you only feel the tingle and numbness in the right foot and toes?

Well, my back hurts and I had cramps in both legs, especially both calves. The cramps have been going on for about a year.

Did the cramping ever go away?

Yes, it did. It went away approximately two months ago.

Do you feel weakness in both legs or just in the right leg?

I feel like it is only the right leg. I do not think my left leg has the same weakness.

Are you having any uncontrolled release of urine or bowel movements?

No, I do not have any uncontrolled bowel movements or urine release.

Are you experiencing any shoot or sharp related pain in your leg?

I am noticing that the strength of my right leg has been getting worse.

Have you seen anyone else for this problem?

Yes. I first went to my primary care physician then they sent me to the neurologist.
Hello! It is nice to meet you.
Are you ready to start your appointment?
I have had this weakness in my right leg for quite some time now.
How long have you been experiencing weakness?
I think that it was about six months ago that the weakness in my leg started. I don't really remember how it happened.
That's fine. Do you remember any accident? Or any kind of trauma or fall that may have led to this weakness?

I was reaching to get something from a cabinet, and I noticed that I was unable to stand on my right toe. Ever since then I have had difficulty pushing off when walking. My toes were tingling and numb.
Have you had any new tingling or numbness since your leg was affected by the weakness? Or has it been a problem for you before? Or did you have tingling or numbness and just didn't notice until now?
It was a mild feeling, but this has been an ongoing problem that has been the same since the weakness started.
Did you have any back pain? Or any radiating back pain that came into the leg? Or a leg cramping feeling?
I have had back pain, but this has been going on for many years and has not changed.
Have you had any weakness or loss of strength in your left leg?
I would say mild. I have also been having cramping in both calves.
Are you right handed or left handed?
For the past year but it stopped about two months ago.
You did not go to the hospital for the pain you felt in your leg and back?
No. I don't think so.
Are you taking any medications?
No. Everything that is going on with my right leg has pretty much been the same since it started six months ago. I have not gotten worse or better.
Since you mentioned that you have been seen by your primary doctor and then a neurologist, can you tell me more about the treatments you had and what more advanced testing you have undergone?
No.
Do you recall the names of the tests that were done?
I saw the other doctor in October. That was a couple of months before I came to see you.
Do you have any copies of the reports from those tests?
I cannot have an MRI because of my ear implant.
Do you happen to have a copy of the CT Scan?
I had an elevated CK before I started taking stat medications.
You said it was before taking stat medications. From my understanding you are referring to Lipitor, correct?
I am not taking Lipitor anymore. I think I took it for about fifteen months.
Can you tell me what the values were regarding your CK Levels before and after starting these medications?

I thought that my CK was in the five hundred or six hundreds prior to starting it. Once I started it, my levels increased to about eight hundred and then came down to about five hundred again when it was stopped. I recently stopped taking Lipitor because my levels were up to the thousand's and then my CK apparently has returned to about the five hundreds or six hundreds.
Do you have the paperwork from these tests?
Yes, he did.
What does the most recent test show on the CK Level?
Yes, I just started Zetia.
Does this cause any closer pain?
No.
Thank you for the information.
I am fifty-five.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: I discussed the case with Poison Control and apparently this is actually relatively small quantity and it is likely to be a nontoxic ingestion if she even ingested, which should does not appear likely to be the case.
It is a small ingestion. It is hard for me to tell that she ingested anything if she did, according to what her family is saying.
Thank god! Thank you.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: The patient does not smoke nor drink alcohol.
Do you smoke or drink alcohol?
No, I do not.
Thank you for the information.
Yeah, it's a bad habit.
Thank you for the information.
No, I don't drink either.
Are you sure?
Yeah.

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: He has diabetes, but this is well controlled.  He also has hepatitis C and HIV.
You well-controlled diabetes, hepatitis C and HIV, correct?
Well, it is well under control.
How long you have been taking the treatments for it?
Yes, I have hepatitis C. I also have HIV.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: Bactrim, which causes nausea and vomiting, and adhesive tape.
Are you allergic to any medications?
Ah, yes I am very allergic to Bactrim.
And no rashes today. Any other allergies?
Yes, It causes me nausea and vomiting.
I see. And I have put it in your file. So, it will automatically go onto the report that you have to carry.
I think I am also allergic to adhesive tape. I get this skin rash almost immediately if I use adhesive tapes.
Got it. Rashes?

You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: This is a 56-year-old female who fell on November 26, 2007 at 11:30 a.m. while at work.  She did not recall the specifics of her injury but she thinks that her right foot inverted and subsequently noticed pain in the right ankle.  She describes no other injury at this time.
Good afternoon ma'am, my name is Doctor Boyd and I'll be taking care of you today. Let's start off by confirming some of your information.
Good afternoon, doctor.
Great, so you're fifty six years old now, right?
I'm fifty six, doctor.
And, you said that this accident happened at work?
I don't remember exactly what happened, but my foot twisted and there was so much pain right away.
What shoe was this foot in?
Um, it was on November twenty sixth two thousand seven. I think it was around eleven thirty in the morning.
What foot was injured?
No, just this one right now.
You are a medical chatbot. You should help the patient by answering their questions and providing advice about the following topic: polysubstance abuse. smoked 1 pack per day for 15years.
Do you currently smoke cigarettes?
Yes, I've been smoking around one pack.
What for how long?
Yes.
Do you have any other illicit substance related abuse problems?
Around fifteen years.
I mean do you have any other substance abuse problems?
